CNFGADDV.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
       %   TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH)
       +   TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)
       _   TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT) PAD(_)
       !   TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(LOW) CAPS(OFF) JUST(LEFT) PAD(_)
       @   TYPE(OUTPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
+COMMAND ===>_ZCMD   +
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

                          %RECOVERY - HOT-SITE - Add Volume Entries+

+------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

+
+Enter Data. Press%PF3+to EXIT%WITHOUT+Adding data.
+
+Do not enter a%count+of devices to%process+additions.
+
+
      Start Unit Address:_Z   +    Beginning CUU address

      Unit Type         :_Z    +   DASD device and (S, D, T)

      Number to ADD     :_Z  +     1 - 128
)INIT
 .ZVARS = '(ADDUUU ADDTYP ADDCNT)'
 .HELP = RCVA0001
)END

CNFGDISP.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
       %   TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH)
       +   TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)
       _   TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT) PAD(_)
       !   TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(LOW) CAPS(OFF) JUST(LEFT) PAD(_)
       :   TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(LOW) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT) PAD(_)
       @   TYPE(OUTPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
+COMMAND ===>_ZCMD  +
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

        +                 %RECOVERY - HOT-SITE Volume List+

+------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

+Cmmds %ADDVOL+Add Volumes %BLDJCL+Build JCL     %DOOVER+Rebuild Table
+      %EDTVOL+Mass Change %SUBJOB+Submit Jobs   %JOBSTA+Job Status
+
+Select   %S+To submit JCL %J+To rebuild JCL %K+To edit skeleton
+     Code%E+To edit JCL   %D+To delete vol  %P+To set status to 'ENDED'
+
+To change data, overtype and press%ENTER.
+
+  Unit   Recover Unit   Home   Job    VTOC   Index  VVDS   JCL       Type of
+S Address Volser Type   VolSer Status Size   Flag   Flag   Skeleton  Restore

)MODEL
_S@Z   + _VOLNAM@VOLTYP_VOLTGT@VOLSTA :Z  +    :Z+    :Z+  _VOLSKL  +   _Z+
   Type of backup tape for restore    :VOLTAP  +            GDG to use:Z +
)INIT
 .ZVARS = '(VOLUUU VOLVTS VOLIDX VOLVVD VOLRST VOLGDG)'
 .HELP = RCVD0101
)END

CNFGJOBS.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
       %   TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH)
       +   TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)
       _   TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT) PAD(_)
       !   TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(LOW) CAPS(OFF) JUST(LEFT) PAD(_)
       :   TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(LOW) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT) PAD(_)
       @   TYPE(OUTPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
+COMMAND ===>_ZCMD   +
+                   %RECOVERY - HOT-SITE Job Status List+

+To view output data, type 'S' in select field and press%ENTER.
+
+  Job      Home      Job         Job
+S Name     Volser    Status      Information

)MODEL ROWS(SCAN)
_S@Z     + @VOLTGT+  @VOLSTA  +  @Z                                    +
)INIT
 .ZVARS = '(VOLJBN VOLJBS)'
 .HELP = RCVJ0001
)END

CNFGSTRT.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
       %   TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH)
       +   TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(LOW)
       _   TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT) PAD(_)
       !   TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(LOW) CAPS(OFF) JUST(LEFT) PAD(_)
       @   TYPE(OUTPUT) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
+COMMAND ===>_ZCMD   +
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

                          %RECOVERY - HOT-SITE - Table and Datasets+

+------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

+
+
      Table name to use :_Z       +

      Submit JCL Library:_Z                                           +

    Skeleton JCL Library:_Z                                           +
+
         Skeleton Member:_Z       +
+
+
+Enter Data. Press%PF3+to EXIT
+
)INIT
 .ZVARS = '(RCVTBL RCVSUB RCVSKL RCVMEM)'
 .CURSOR =  RCVTBL
 .HELP = RCVS0001
)END

RCVA0001.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
)BODY
%------------------------------ RECOVERY HELP ----------------------------------
%Command ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
                            %D/R Add Volumes

+  START UNIT ADDRESS field is a 4 hex character UCB given to you by the
+    disaster recovery site technicians for your use.
+
+  UNIT TYPE field is 3380 or 3390 followed by S/D/T for single double or
+    triple type of dasd unit to restore to.
+
+  NUMBER TO ADD field is the number of dasd devices that you will be using
+    at the recovery site. You specify from 1 to 128.
+
+  You finish using this dialog by not entering any information in the
+    NUMBER TO ADD field and pressing the <ENTER> key.
+
+
+
+
+
+
+
+
)PROC
 &ZCONT = RCVA0001
)END

RCVD0001.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
)BODY
%------------------------------ RECOVERY HELP ----------------------------------
%Command ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
                            %D/R Volume List Commands

+        ADDVOL        Adds volumes
+
+        EDTVOL        Allows multiple Volume Edits
+
+        DUPVOL        Checks for duplicate volume assignments
+
+        BLDJCL        Generates JCL for all volumes
+
+        SUBJOB        Submits all generated jobs
+
+        JOBSTA        Displays status of submitted jobs and allows views of
+                      completed jobs
+        DOOVER        Delete table values start over
+
+        SECURE        Generates ICK/DSF secure volume
+
+
+
+
)PROC
   &ZCONT = RCVD0002
)END

RCVD0002.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
)BODY
%------------------------------ RECOVERY HELP ----------------------------------
%Command ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
                            %D/R Volume List Line Commands

+                 Data overtyped on the line will be modified
+
+        J        Regenerate JCL for job
+
+        E        Edit/display JCL
+
+        S        Submits restore job for thsi volume
+
+        D        Deletes this volume from table
+
+        K        Edit/display Skeleton member
+
+        P        Set job status to complete
+
+
+
+
+
+
)PROC
 &ZCONT = RCVD0002
)END

RCVD0101.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
)BODY
%------------------------------ RECOVERY HELP ----------------------------------
%Command ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
                            %D/R HOT-SITE Volume List

+  This is the main dialog for the generation of JCL, job submission and
+    job checking for the Disaster Recovery process. Commands are entered
+    to initially add the number of volumes that will be restored.  A fast
+    path dialog is utilized to quickly enter the names of the volumes
+    being restored and type of restore.  Limited error checking on
+    duplicate named volumes can be done. A process of building all of the
+    jobs through a skeleton can be done.  Jobs can be checked for
+    completion.  The entire scheme can be redone by a command to remove all
+    the volumes and generated JCL.  JCL can also be generated to secure the
+    volumes after the recovery by initialization.
+
+  Line commands are also available to do many of the above commands but
+    on an volume by volume basis.
+
+
+
+
+
+
)PROC
   &ZCONT = RCVD0001
)END

RCVJ0001.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
)BODY
%------------------------------ RECOVERY HELP ----------------------------------
%Command ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
                            %D/R Job Status List

+  This screen is used to display status of jobs waiting to execute,
+    executing or on the output queue to be checked.  You can only view
+    those jobs which have finished and have a status of SUBMIT or CHECKED.
+    When a finished submitted job has been viewed its status becomes
+    checked. You will not be able to view checked jobs through this dialog
+    again until the job has been rebuilt, submitted or ended.  If there are
+    duplicate instances, only the highest job number will show.
+
+  The S field requies an S to view job output from finished jobs.
+
+  The REFRESH command on the command field will update the status of jobs.
+    Also the <PF3> key after viewing a browsed job output will update the
+    screen statues.
+
+
+
+
+
+
)PROC
 &ZCONT = RCVJ0001
)END

RCVS0001.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
)BODY
%------------------------------ RECOVERY HELP ----------------------------------
%Command ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
                            %D/R Table and Datasets

+  TABLE NAME field is the name of the table that you will be editting
+    for this recovery session.  You can create multiple tables but are
+    able to only use one at a time.
+
+  SUBMIT JCL LIBRARY field is the name of the library where the generated
+    JCL resides.  This field is setup by the RCVRSTRT exec and usually not
+    changed.
+
+  SKELETON JCL LIBRARY field is the name of library where the skeleton for
+    JCL generation resides. This field is setup by the RCVRSTRT exec and
+    not usually changed.
+
+  SKELETON MEMBER field is the name of the JCL generation skeleton. This
+    field is not usually changed. It is created by a systems programmer
+    for the company and named in the RCVRSTRT exec.
+
+
+
+
)PROC
 &ZCONT = RCVS0001
)END

RCVV0001.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
)BODY
%------------------------------ RECOVERY HELP ----------------------------------
%Command ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
+
                            %D/R Mass Change Volume List

+  This screen is used to rapidly setup the volume restore list.
+
+  HOME VOLSER field is overtyped with the volume serial name of volume
+    that you are restoring.
+
+  TYPE OF RESTORE field detemines what type of restore will be attempted
+    and the JCL generated to do the job.
+    R - FDR nonSMS restore              C - ICKDSF clear volume contents
+    S - FDR SMS volume restore          I - ICKDSF nonSMS initialize
+    K - FDR nonSMS Compactor restore    J - ICKDSF SMS initialize
+    A - FDR ABR restore
+
+  INDEX FLAG field is Y or N for indexed VTOC on the volume.  This is used
+    in conjunction with the ICKDSF restore.
+
+  VVDS FLAG field is Y or N for creating a VVDS on the volume to support
+    VSAM on the volume. This is used in conjunction with the ICKDSF restore.
+
+
)PROC
 &ZCONT = RCVV0001
)END
